metadata.Title: CVE-2020-22022 on Ubuntu 22.04 ESM (jammy) - medium
metadata.Description:
A heap-based Buffer Overflow vulnerability exists in FFmpeg 4.2 infilter_frame at libavfilter/vf_fieldorder.c, which might lead to memorycorruption and other potential consequences.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-22022` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

ffmpeg - 7:4.4.1-3ubuntu2
libavcodec-extra - 7:4.4.1-3ubuntu2
libavcodec-extra58 - 7:4.4.1-3ubuntu2
libavcodec58 - 7:4.4.1-3ubuntu2
libavdevice58 - 7:4.4.1-3ubuntu2
libavfilter-extra - 7:4.4.1-3ubuntu2
libavfilter-extra7 - 7:4.4.1-3ubuntu2
libavfilter7 - 7:4.4.1-3ubuntu2
libavformat-extra - 7:4.4.1-3ubuntu2
libavformat-extra58 - 7:4.4.1-3ubuntu2
libavformat58 - 7:4.4.1-3ubuntu2
libavutil56 - 7:4.4.1-3ubuntu2
libpostproc55 - 7:4.4.1-3ubuntu2
libswresample3 - 7:4.4.1-3ubuntu2
libswscale5 - 7:4.4.1-3ubuntu2
No subscription required

criterions.comment: ffmpeg package in jammy, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '7:4.4.1-3ubuntu2').
qtwebengine-opensource-src package in esm-apps/jammy is affected and may need fixing.
vice package in esm-apps/jammy is affected and may need fixing.
